title: [Health] More trusting societies have been more successful at reducing coronavirus cases and deaths. Researchers found there is a “threshold effect” in nations where at least 40 per cent of people agree “most people can be trusted”.

[Medicine] Women vaccinated against COVID-19 saw a slight delay in their period of almost a day. The slight increase in menstrual cycle length is not clinically significant. Any change of fewer than eight days is classified as normal by the International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics. N=4,000
